workflow.name: Send automatic WhatsApp order confirmations from Shopify with Rapiwa API
workflow.description:
# Send Automatic WhatsApp Order Confirmations from Shopify with Rapiwa API

## Who‚Äôs it for
This **n8n workflow** helps Shopify store owners and teams **automatically confirm orders via WhatsApp**. It checks if the customer's number is valid using **Rapiwa API**, sends a personalized message, and logs every attempt in **Google Sheets**‚Äîsaving time and reducing manual work.

Whether you're a solo entrepreneur or managing a small team, this solution gives you a **low-cost alternative** to the official WhatsApp Business API, without losing control or personalization.

## Features
- Receives new order details via webhook upon order creation or update.
- Iterates over incoming data in manageable batches for smoother processing.
- Extracts and formats customer and order details from the Shopify webhook payload.
- Strips non-numeric characters from WhatsApp numbers for consistent formatting.
- Uses Rapiwa API to check if the WhatsApp number is valid and active.
- Branches the workflow based on number validity ‚Äî separates verified from unverified.
- Sends a custom WhatsApp confirmation message to verified customers using Rapiwa.
- Updates Google Sheet rows with `status` and `validity`

## How it Works / What It Does
* Triggered by a **Shopify webhook** or by reading rows from a **Google Sheet**.
* **Normalizes and cleans** the order payload.
* Extracts details like customer name, phone, items, shipping, and payment info.
* Cleans phone numbers (removes special characters).
* Verifies if the number is registered on WhatsApp via **Rapiwa API**.
* If valid:

  * Sends a **templated WhatsApp message**.
  * Updates Google Sheet with `validity = verified` and `status = sent`.
* If invalid:

  * Skips sending.
  * Updates sheet with `validity = unverified` and `status = not sent`.
* Adds **wait/delay between sends** to prevent rate limits.
* Keeps an **audit trail** in the connected Google Sheet.

---

## How to Set Up
1. Set up a **Shopify webhook** for new orders (or connect a Google Sheet).
2. Create a Google Sheet with columns:

   * `name`, `number`, `order id`, `item name`, `total price`, `validity`, `status`
3. Create and configure a **Rapiwa Bearer token** in n8n.
4. Add **Google Sheets OAuth2 credential** in n8n.
5. Import the workflow in n8n and configure these nodes:
   * Webhook or Sheet Trigger
   * Loop Over Items (SplitInBatches)
   * Normalize Payload (Code)
   * Clean WhatsApp Number (Code)
   * Rapiwa WhatsApp Check (HTTP Request)
   * Conditional Branch (If)
   * Send WhatsApp Message (HTTP Request)
   * Update Google Sheet (Google Sheets)
   * Wait Node (delay per send)

---

## Requirements
* Shopify store with order webhook enabled (or order list in Google Sheet)
* A verified **Rapiwa API token**
* A working **n8n instance** with HTTP and Google Sheets nodes enabled
* A Google Sheet with required structure and valid OAuth credentials in n8n

---

## How to Customize the Workflow
* Modify the **message template** with your own brand tone or emojis.
* Add **country-code logic** in the Clean Number node if needed.
* Use a **unique `order id`** in your Google Sheet to prevent mismatches.
* Increase or decrease delay in the Wait node (e.g., 5‚Äì10 seconds).
* Use additional logic in Code nodes to handle discounts, promotions, or more line items.

---

## Workflow Highlights
- Triggered by **Shopify webhook** update.
- Receiving new order data form Shopify using webhook
- Cleans and extracts order data from raw payload.
- Normalizing and validating the customer‚Äôs WhatsApp number using the **Rapiwa API**
- Verifies WhatsApp number using **Rapiwa's `verify-whatsapp` endpoint**.
- Sends order confirmation via **Rapiwa's `send-message` endpoint**.
- Logs every result into **Google Sheets** (verified/unverified + sent/not sent).

---

## Setup in n8n

### 1. Check WhatsApp Registration
* Use an HTTP Request node:

  * URL: `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp`
  * Method: `POST`
  * Auth: `httpBearerAuth` using your Rapiwa token
  * Body: `{ "number": "cleaned_number" }`

### 2. Branch Based on Validity
* Use an `If` node:

  * Condition: `{{ $json.data.exists }} == true` (or `"true"` if string)

### 3. Send Message via Rapiwa
* Endpoint: `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message`
* Method: `POST`
* Body:

 ```
 Hi *{{ $json.customer_full_name }}*,
 Thank you for shopping with *SpaGreen Creative*! We're happy to confirm that your order has been successfully placed.
 üßæ Order Details
 ‚Ä¢ Product: {{ $json.line_item.title }}
 ‚Ä¢ SKU: {{ $json.line_item.sku }}
 ‚Ä¢ Quantity: {{ $json.line_item.quantity }}
 ‚Ä¢ Vendor: {{ $json.line_item.vendor }}
 ‚Ä¢ Order ID: {{ $json.name }}
 ‚Ä¢ Product ID: {{ $json.line_item.product_id }}
 üì¶ Shipping Information
 {{ $json.shipping_address.address1 }} {{ $json.shipping_address.address2 }}
 {{ $json.shipping_address.city }}, {{ $json.shipping_address.country }} - {{ $json.shipping_address.zip }}
 üí≥ Payment Summary
 ‚Ä¢ Subtotal: {{ $json.subtotal_price }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Tax (VAT): {{ $json.total_tax_amount }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Shipping: {{ $json.total_shipping_amount }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Discount: {{ $json.total_discount_amount }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Total Paid: {{ $json.total_price }} BDT
 Order Date: {{ $json.created_date }}
 Warm wishes,
 *Team SpaGreen Creative*
 ```

## Sample Google Sheet Structure
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1b5b9kvkfuCMtZ-7Z-w21sXOmHFmQ30N1iQPc2WMStEo/edit?usp=sharing)  


| name        | number        | order id      | item name                      | total price | validity | status |
| ----------- | ------------- | ------------- | ------------------------------ | ----------- | -------- | ------ |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799| 8986469695806 | Iphone 10                      | 1150        | verified | sent   |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799| 8986469695806 | S25 UltraXXXXeen Android Phone | 23000       | verified | sent   |

---

## Tips
* Always ensure phone numbers have a country code (e.g., 880 for BD).
* Clean numbers with regex: `replace(/\D/g, '')`
* Adjust Rapiwa API response parsing depending on actual structure (`true` vs `"true"`).
* Use `row_number` for sheet updates, or unique `order id` for better targeting.
* Use the Wait node to add 3‚Äì10 seconds between sends.

---

## Important Notes
* Avoid reordering sheet rows‚Äîupdates rely on consistent `row_number`.
* `shopify-app-auth` is the credential name used in the export‚Äîmake sure it's your Rapiwa token.
* Use a test sheet before going live.
* Rapiwa has request limits‚Äîavoid rapid sending.
* Add media/image logic later using `message_type: media`.

---

## Future Enhancements (Ideas)
* Add Telegram/Slack alert once the batch finishes.
* Include media (e.g., product image, invoice) in the message.
* Detect and resend failed messages.
* Integrate with Shopify‚Äôs GraphQL API for additional data.
* Auto-mark fulfillment status based on WhatsApp confirmation.

---

## Support & Community
* WhatsApp: [8801322827799](https://wa.me/8801322827799)
* Discord: [discord](https://discord.gg/SsCChWEP)
* Facebook Group: [facebook group](https://www.facebook.com/groups/spagreenbd)
* Website: [https://spagreen.net](https://spagreen.net)
* Envato/Codecanyon: [codecanyon portfolio](https://codecanyon.net/user/spagreen/portfolio)

---

workflow.name: Send Automatic WhatsApp Order Confirmations from Shopify with Rapiwa API

nodes.name: Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa1

parameters.content:
## Clean and Verify WhatsApp Numbers
Before sending messages, each WhatsApp number is cleaned (removing spaces and symbols) and checked to make sure it‚Äôs a real, active WhatsApp account. Only valid numbers will get a message, so you don‚Äôt waste time or credits.

- **Node:** Clean WhatsApp Number

**Purpose:** Removes extra characters (like spaces, dashes, or parentheses) from the phone number.

**Why it's important:** WhatsApp only accepts clean numeric formats. This step avoids delivery errors.

- **Node:** Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa
  - Checks if the WhatsApp number is real and can receive messages.
  - Only valid numbers will get a message.

## Conditional Logic

The **If** node checks whether `data.exists == true`:

- **True branch (verified):**
  - Sends a WhatsApp confirmation via Rapiwa.
  - Appends to Google Sheets with validity: verified.

- **False branch (unverified):**
  - Appends data to the sheet with validity: unverified.

## Send Message via HTTP Request Using Rapiwa

**Purpose:** Sends the actual message via the Rapiwa API.

**How it works:** Makes a POST request to `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message` with:
- `number`: Cleaned WhatsApp number  
- `message`: The text from the sheet

**Why it's important:** This is the core of the automation ‚Äî it connects your message to WhatsApp via Rapiwa.



## Change State of Rows in Sent
**Why it's important:** So you don‚Äôt accidentally resend the same message in the next cycle. Keeps track of what‚Äôs already done.

Two separate Google Sheets nodes:
- **Verified append row in sheet** ‚Äì for valid numbers.
- **Unverified append row in sheet** ‚Äì for invalid numbers.
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1b5b9kvkfuCMtZ-7Z-w21sXOmHFmQ30N1iQPc2WMStEo/edit?usp=sharing)

## Append Unverified Row to Sheet
This node is triggered after a phone number is checked and found to be **unverified**. It appends the form submission data to the Google Sheet with the field `validity` set to `"unverified"`.

This node appends data to a Google Sheet when a WhatsApp number is **unverified**.
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1H29z_8tnsu8AvCsI7o1SjiV-5LDTwiVVQk-BNr8SMk0/edit?usp=sharing)  


## Wait

**Purpose:** Pauses for a few seconds (e.g., 5 sec) before sending the next message.

**Why it's important:** Prevents sending too many messages too quickly, which could get your WhatsApp number flagged or blocked.

nodes.name: Change State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent

documentId.cachedResultName: Shopify - Send WhatsApp confirmation with order ID

parameters.content:
## Webhook

### Purpose:
- Listens for incoming **HTTP POST requests**.
- This webhook is likely triggered by an event (e.g., order creation or update) from an external platform like **Shopify** or **WooCommerce**.
- The incoming data is passed to the next node for processing.

## Loop Over Items
**Purpose:** Goes through each row (message) one by one.
**Why it's important:** Ensures that each message is processed separately and in order.


##  & Code
### Function:
- Extracts and transforms incoming JSON data into a cleaner, structured format.
- Specifically:
  - Extracts customer information (`email`, `phone`, `name`, `ID`, full name, country, etc.).
  - Extracts address data (both default and shipping addresses).
  - Extracts financial data (subtotal, total, taxes, discounts, shipping).
  - Extracts line item (product) details like title, SKU, vendor, product ID, etc.
- Returns a clean, ready-to-use object for further processing (e.g., verification, messaging, storage).

### Like Key Fields Extracted:
- `customer_email`, `customer_phone`, `customer_full_name`, `customer_id`
- `customer_address` and `shipping_address`
- `total_price`, `subtotal_price`, `total_tax_amount`, etc.
- `line_item`: `title`, `sku`, `quantity`, `vendor`, `product_id`
- `created_date`, `updated_at`

# Send Automatic WhatsApp Order Confirmations from Shopify with Rapiwa API

 ## Overview
 This n8n workflow receives new order data, normalizes the payload, validates the customer's WhatsApp number using the Rapiwa API, sends a personalized order confirmation message to verified numbers, and logs every attempt to Google Sheets.

## Why use this workflow
 - Automated order confirmations via WhatsApp (no manual messaging)
 - Personalized messages with order, payment and shipping details
 - Keeps a clean audit trail in Google Sheets (sent / not sent, verified / unverified)
 - Batching + wait/delays helps avoid rate limits and number flags

## Quick features
 - Accepts webhook or Google Sheet rows as input
 - Cleans and normalizes phone numbers
 - Verifies WhatsApp registration with Rapiwa
 - Sends templated WhatsApp messages via Rapiwa
 - Updates Google Sheet rows with `status` and `validity`

## Requirements
 - Shopify order webhook or sheet with new order rows
 - Rapiwa account + API access (Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE)
 - Google Sheets OAuth2 credential configured in n8n
 - A Google Sheet with columns: `name`, `number`, `order id`, `item name`, `total price`, `validity`, `status` (see sample below)

## High-level flow (step-by-step)
 1. Webhook / Trigger
    - Node: `Webhook` (or Google Sheets trigger)
    - What: Receives new order data (Shopify webhook or sheet row).

 2. Split into single items
    - Node: `Loop Over Items` (SplitInBatches)
    - What: Process one order at a time to allow per-order logic and batching.

 3. Normalize payload
    - Node: `Clean Webhooks Response Data` (Code)
    - What: Extract customer, order, shipping and line-item fields into a consistent JSON structure like `customer_full_name`, `customer_phone`, `line_item.title`, `total_price`.

 4. Clean WhatsApp number
    - Node: `Clean WhatsApp Number` (Code)
    - What: Remove all non-digit characters: `waNoStr.replace(/\D/g, "")`.
    - Note: This step does not add a country code ‚Äî ensure numbers include the country code or add logic to prepend it.

 5. Verify WhatsApp registration
    - Node: `Check valid whatsapp number Using Rapiwa1` (HTTP Request)
    - Endpoint: `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/verify-whatsapp` (POST)
    - Auth: `Rapiwa Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE` (httpBearerAuth)
    - What: Returns `data.exists` indicating whether the number is WhatsApp-registered.

 6. Branch on validity
    - Node: `If`
    - Condition: `={{ $json.data.exists }}` equals `"true"` (in the export). Verify this in your environment ‚Äî adjust to a boolean check if needed.

    If verified:
    - Node: `Send Message Using Rapiwa` (HTTP Request)
      - Endpoint: `https://app.rapiwa.com/api/send-message` (POST)
      - Body: `number`, `message_type: text`, `message` (templated)
      - Auth: `shopify-app-auth` (httpHeaderAuth in the export) ‚Äî make sure it matches your Rapiwa credential type.
    - Node: `Change State of Rows in Verified & Sent` (Google Sheets)
      - Action: Update row with `validity: verified`, `status: sent`, and other mapped columns.

    If not verified:
    - Node: `Change State of Rows in Unverified & Not Sent` (Google Sheets)
      - Action: Update row with `validity: unverified`, `status: not sent`.

 7. Wait and continue
    - Node: `Wait`
    - What: Pause between iterations (e.g., 3‚Äì10 seconds) to avoid rate limits and reduce risk of being flagged.

## Message template (example)
 Use the templated message in `Send Message Using Rapiwa` (multiline text):

 ```
 Hi *{{ $json.customer_full_name }}*,
 Thank you for shopping with *SpaGreen Creative*! We're happy to confirm that your order has been successfully placed.
 üßæ Order Details
 ‚Ä¢ Product: {{ $json.line_item.title }}
 ‚Ä¢ SKU: {{ $json.line_item.sku }}
 ‚Ä¢ Quantity: {{ $json.line_item.quantity }}
 ‚Ä¢ Vendor: {{ $json.line_item.vendor }}
 ‚Ä¢ Order ID: {{ $json.name }}
 ‚Ä¢ Product ID: {{ $json.line_item.product_id }}
 üì¶ Shipping Information
 {{ $json.shipping_address.address1 }} {{ $json.shipping_address.address2 }}
 {{ $json.shipping_address.city }}, {{ $json.shipping_address.country }} - {{ $json.shipping_address.zip }}
 üí≥ Payment Summary
 ‚Ä¢ Subtotal: {{ $json.subtotal_price }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Tax (VAT): {{ $json.total_tax_amount }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Shipping: {{ $json.total_shipping_amount }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Discount: {{ $json.total_discount_amount }} BDT
 ‚Ä¢ Total Paid: {{ $json.total_price }} BDT
 Order Date: {{ $json.created_date }}
 Warm wishes,
 *Team SpaGreen Creative*
 ```

## Google Sheet sample
 A suggested sheet layout (header row):
- **A Google Sheet** formatted like this ‚û§ [Sample](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1b5b9kvkfuCMtZ-7Z-w21sXOmHFmQ30N1iQPc2WMStEo/edit?usp=sharing)  


| name        | number        | order id      | item name                      | total price | validity | status |
| ----------- | ------------- | ------------- | ------------------------------ | ----------- | -------- | ------ |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | 8986469695806 | Iphone 10                      | 1150        | verified | sent   |
| Abdul Mannan | 8801322827799 | 8986469695806 | S25 UltraXXXXeen Android Phone | 23000       | verified | sent   |


## Configuration & notes
 - Credentials in the export:
   - `Rapiwa Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE` (httpBearerAuth) ‚Äî used by the verification node.
   - `shopify-app-auth` (httpHeaderAuth) ‚Äî used by the send-message node in the export; make sure you use the correct credential type for Rapiwa in your instance.
 - The `If` node compares to `"true"` string ‚Äî adjust to a boolean test if Rapiwa returns boolean `true/false`.
 - `Clean WhatsApp Number` strips non-digits but does not add country codes.
 - The Google Sheets nodes use `row_number` to match rows for updates ‚Äî avoid reordering rows or prefer a unique `order id` for resilience.

## Quick troubleshooting
 - No messages sent: inspect the `Check valid whatsapp number` node output to verify `data.exists`.
 - Wrong phone formats: add country-code normalization in the `Clean WhatsApp Number` node.
 - Google Sheets update fails: check the sheet ID, sheet gid, and credential permissions.

## Workflow Summary:

1. **Webhook** receives a POST request with raw order/customer data.
2. Data is passed to **Loop Over Items**, which processes each item one at a time or in batches.
3. **Code** node reformats and cleans the data into a structured JSON format for use in later parts of the workflow (e.g., validation, messaging, or storage).

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
